attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 19.05.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The findings revealed a cumulative bread shortfall of 262.5 loaves and a positive variance of +745 pieces in polybags.

                                                      

                                        Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Bread shortfall should be recovered and appropriate measures taken to curb cases of stock variances in future.
attributes.effect: Bread shortfall 262.5 loaves amounting to Ksh. 14,043 is an indication that stock controls are not adhered to exposing the company to losses.

value: Variance will be recovered and I promise to improve.
Bread variance reported in the previous audit findings was +876 loaves and polybags had a cumulative shortfall of 218 pieces.

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        All sample varieties had few cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 03%, 400g W- 3% and 800g W- 0%.

                     The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.effect: •    Few cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are adhered to.

value: •    Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.

attributes.title: Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Analysis of bread damages from 10.04.25 – 18.05.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 1,301.5 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.20% of the total loaves produced.

·        1,576.75 loaves were damaged under market damages (market returns and expired bread) representing 0.22% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        Market damages exceeded the set limit by 112 loaves worth Ksh. 5,992 while production damages were within the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: •    The management to ensure that both production and market damages are maintained within the set limit.
attributes.effect: •    Market damages slightly exceeded the set limit indicating that the company is exposed to losses due to excess bread damages.

value: •    We will improve on the market damages.
•    Production damages exceeded the set limit by 335 loaves in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Mixing charts analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 10.04.25 – 18.05.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material usage.

·        No significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: •    The branch should continue observing the set production standards.

value: •    No variances was reported in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
Findings;
•    A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch petty cash was well kept and proper records maintained.
•    No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: •    The branch should ensure that petty cash records and balances are well maintained.
attributes.effect: •    The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: •    No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Production efficiency was analyzed from 10.04.25 – 18.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set production target of 5 bags per worker.

·        The branch hired a total of 722 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 3,204 bags.

·        The actual production was 3,204 bags leading to a production shortfall of 45 bags.

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: •    Management to improve on the planning of production workers to ensure that the set efficiency is consistently achieved.
attributes.effect: •    Production shortfall of 45 bags is an indication that the company incurred extra production costs worth Ksh. 10,860

value: •    The set production target was not achieved in the previous audit findings. Production shortfall was 103 bags.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Packaging efficiency was analyzed from 10.04.25 – 18.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per packer.

·        The total bread to be packed over the audited period is 45,584 crates hence the expected slicers to be recruited was 470 workers.

·        The branch hired 498 packers leading to excess 28 workers and a packaging efficiency of 91.5 crates per packer which is below the set standard.

Details of packing efficiency
attributes.recommendation: •    The management should improve on the planning of packaging workers to ensure that the set efficiency is always achieved.
attributes.effect: •    The set efficiency was not achieved indicating that packaging cost exceeded the budget by Ksh. 25,536.

value: •    Packaging efficiency was not achieved in the previous audit findings. Extra packers hired were 18.

attributes.title: Delivery vehicle fuel efficiency analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;
•    Analysis of fuel consumption by the delivery vehicles was done for the month of April 2025 to verify if their consumption rate is within the set standards.
•    Comparison between the actual fuel used and standard fuel set was done for the 3 motor vehicles assigned to the branch KCX 072Q,  KCN 885L and KCW 089A.
•    No material variance between the actual fuel usage and the set standards.
attributes.recommendation: •    The set controls on fuel usage should be strictly adhered.
attributes.effect: •    Fuel consumption rates are within the range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.

value: •    Fuel consumption was within the range for the three vehicles in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Generator fuel efficiency analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Review of generator records was done to ascertain that its use is as per the set policies.

·        Comparison of manager records and system records was done to ensure accurate records and readings are maintained.

·        The average fuel consumption rate was 45.3 Ltrs per hour which is within the standard set of 65 L/hr.

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch management to ensure that proper controls are always adhered.

value: •    The average fuel consumption rate reported in the previous audit findings was 56.11 L/Hr.
